projectPurpose: To provide a faster, more intelligent, and user-friendly way to navigate the filesystem in the command line by learning user habits and allowing quick jumps to frequently accessed locations.
mainFeatures: Learns and ranks frequently used directories based on usage
Allows jumping to directories with partial path matching
Supports all major shells (Bash, Fish, Zsh, PowerShell, etc.)
Interactive directory selection with fzf
Fast performance due to being written in Rust
Minimal and ergonomic interface
Ability to import data from other jump tools like autojump and z

alternatives.name: autojump
platforms: Supports Bash, Zsh, Fish, Tcsh, Clink
mainFeatures: Learns directories based on frequency of use
Jumps to directories with partial names
Supports multiple arguments for refinement
Can open directories in a file manager
Adjustable directory priority weighting

alternatives.name: z (rupa/z)
mainFeatures: Jumps based on 'frecency' (frequency + recency)
Matches partial paths
Minimalist design

alternatives.name: fasd
mainFeatures: Provides quick access to files and directories
Ranks files and directories by 'frecency'
Offers aliases for quick access (f, a, s, d)
Supports tab completion

alternatives.name: jump (gsamokovarov/jump)
platforms: Supports Bash, Zsh, Fish, PowerShell, Murex
mainFeatures: Learns directory navigation habits
Provides most visited directory for a search term
Supports 'deep jump' for nested paths
Can import data from autojump or z

alternatives.name: Jumpy (ClementNerma/Jumpy)
mainFeatures: Quickly jump to previously visited directories
Inspired by Zoxide
Aims to be lightweight and fast

marketPositioning: zoxide is positioned as a modern, fast, and user-friendly replacement for the standard `cd` command. Building upon the concepts of earlier directory jump tools like `autojump` and `z`, zoxide differentiates itself through its superior performance (written in Rust), broad shell compatibility, and a focus on a minimal, ergonomic interface. It targets users who want to streamline their command-line workflow and navigate their filesystem more efficiently by leveraging learned habits and providing quick jumping and interactive selection capabilities.
